comments.body: Is there any means to properly helps new users understand the rules and regulations of this forum?Because I understand that the above-mentioned user doesn't follow the rules that governed the forum and in that case will receive what it takes of not following the instructions.What i will suggest is that as soon a user sign up on the forum the next message they should see as a pop-up messages should be rules and regulations so as to adhere strictly on those law, I believe if him or she is ban she may not know his offense of getting ban.

He had zero interest in the forum except spam in order to increase the activity score and farm the account. If even the pop-up containing the rules was there, trust me he would ignore it, just like people ignore reading terms and conditions when signing up for a site.

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: As he is already banned so i think this case/topic will be locked. But i have to admit one thing that, many members take much time to get some attention so that they could be remembered (but of course in a good way not like this member in a bad way). But this member has really got the attention of all, like by just burst posting.I think he is not banned for burst posting, he might be banned for few words posting/single line posting. And currently the big issue behind is UI and efficient hands on the beginner help. Like, i think all the basic rules for a newbie must be shown at the reply page when they are making a reply or making a topic.There must be a set of rules shown to them so that before writing anything they quickly goes through them and if the rules are provided in a way where the checkpoint are also provided then i don't think any member will be banned due to such mistakes.
